travels.short_text: Rizal passed through Singapore aboard the SS Salvadora under the name Jose Mercado on his way to Europe.

travels.reason: Education, observation, and exposure to liberal ideas
travels.short_text: Rizal traveled across Europe, observing Western societies and publishing patriotic writings such as Amor Patrio.
He trained under leading ophthalmologists while continuing literary and reformist activities.
Rizal traveled through Asia, formed friendships, and experienced racial discrimination in Japan and Hong Kong.
Rizal visited the U.S., noting both its democratic ideals and racial discrimination against Asians.
In London, Rizal annotated Antonio de Morga's Sucesos de las Islas Filipinas and joined reformist groups.
Rizal wrote major reformist essays and completed El Filibusterismo while facing personal and political struggles.
Rizal practiced ophthalmology, reunited with family, and drafted plans for La Liga Filipina.
